description: Erection of two pairs of semi-detached houses and a pair of semi-detached bungalows following demolition of the two storey side extension and outbuilding to 158 Ash Grove and demolition of garage to 156 Ash Grove, with associated amenity, car parking and cycle and bin stores.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [Air Quality Assessment February 2023; Highways Support Statement 27th January 2023; Planning Statement; Planning Fire Safety Strategy 08/02/2023; Combined Flood Risk Assessment and Drainage Impact Assessment 22706-DIA-001 Rev A; Preliminary Ecological Assessment ASW/MBL/136/26/2022 January 2023. Arboricultural Impact Assessment Report 17th January 2023. Received: 20 February 2023. 22110-OA-B1-ZZ-DR-A-3005 Rev P4; 22110-OA-B1-ZZ-DR-A-5005; 22110-OA-B1-ZZ-DR-A-5004 P01. Received: 24 March 2023. MA/22008/ATR005.1; Energy Statement April 2023; AMA/22008/SK002; 22110-OA-B1-ZZ-DR-A-5006 Rev P3; 22110-OA-B1-ZZ-DR-A-5003 Rev P5; 22110-OA-B1-ZZ-DR-A-5002 Rev P5; 22110-OA-B1-ZZ-DR-A-4000 rev P2; 22110-OA-B1-ZZ-DR-A-1001 Rev P6. Received: 09 May 2023. 22110-OA-B1-ZZ-DR-A-5001 Rev P4. Received: 25 May 2023. Noise Assessment for Planning 1st June 2023. Received: 01 June 2023. AMA/22008/ATR007; MA/22008/SK006. Received: 20 June 2023. 22110-OA-B1-ZZ-DR-A-2000 Rev P4; 22110-OA-B1-ZZ-DR-A-3006 Rev P3; 22110-OA-B1-ZZ-DR-A-1002 Rev P9; 22110-OA-B1-RF-DR-A-3004 Rev P11; 22110-OA-B1-ZZ-DR-A-3000 Rev P17; 22110-OA-B1-ZZ-DR-A-3003 Rev P6; 22110-OA-B1-ZZ-DR-A-3001 Rev P7; 22110-OA-B1-ZZZ-DR-A-3005 Rev P8; 22110-OA-B1-ZZ-DR-A-3002 Rev P9; 2211-OA-B1-ZZ-DR-A-3000 Rev P17 COL. Received: 30 June 2023.].

Condition : 4 - (a) The development hereby permitted shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy.
(b) Prior to first occupation of any dwelling within the development hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure/National Calculation Method) shall be submitted to the local planning authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions, and achieved a ?% reduction in emissions.
(c) Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, suitable devices for the monitoring of the low and zero carbon technologies shall have been installed, and the monitored data shall be submitted automatically to a monitoring web-platform at daily intervals for a period of three years from the point of full operation. The data shall be made available to the local planning authority on request for a period of five years.
Condition : 5 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) hereby approved, the development shall have been constructed to achieve an internal water use of 105 litres/person/day or less.

Condition : 6 - (A) No development above ground level shall take place until details have been submitted to and approved by the local planning authority which demonstrate that:

(i)	At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
(ii)	At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
(iii)	No construction or insulation materials are to be used which would release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.
(B) The development shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts) has been submitted to the local planning authority to demonstrate that the development has been carried out in accordance with the approved details under Part A of this condition. The development shall be maintained in accordance with the approved details at all times thereafter.

Condition : 7 - No development shall take place until the applicant has entered into a binding arrangement with the Council to make an agreed contribution to the Council's Carbon Offset Fund, in accordance with the zero carbon strategy set out in the Energy Statement hereby approved to an amount that equates to the shortfall in required energy savings to meet the 'zero carbon' target.

Condition : 9 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 1995 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order), no enlargement of the premises or any additional structures/buildings/enclosures within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out, other than as shown in the approved drawings, and no additional floor space shall be formed within the building(s) hereby permitted by means of internal horizontal division (new mezzanine level) without prior written approval of the local planning authority.

Condition : 10 - The windows formed in the north elevation of 'house 4' shall be obscure-glazed and non-opening below 1.7 metres above internal floor level. The windows shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than in accordance with the requirements of this condition.

Condition : 11 - Prior to the first use or occupation of the development full details (including manufacturers' specifications) of secure covered cycle parking facilities that accord with the West London Cycle Parking Guidance (for not less than two bicycles per dwelling) for the occupants of, and visitors to, the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use before the development is first occupied or brought into use, The approved facilities shall be thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 12 - The hereby approved development shall be constructed in strict accordance with the mitigation measures outlined in the submitted Air Quality Assessment dated February 2023 received on the 20th February 2023 for the course of the development.

Condition : 13 - The building shall be constructed so as to provide sound insulation against externally generated noise in accordance with the targets of British Standards BS8233:2014 with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided. Any sound insulation works shall be completed before the building is first occupied or brought into use and retained as such thereafter.

Condition : 14 - No development shall take place until a scheme and timetable for the investigation and recording of contamination on the site, prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised individual, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. This scheme shall include a contaminated land phase 1 desk study report detailing the history of the site, hazardous materials and substances used, together with details of a site investigation strategy based on the information revealed in the desk study. The report shall include the aims and objectives, data collection, site reconnaissance (walk over survey), and development of the initial Conceptual Model (CM), which identifies all potential pollutant linkages on the site. The report shall also specify any necessary further information gathering and intrusive investigation that will be required to ensure that it will be possible to render the site safe for its proposed use.  

The approved investigation shall be carried out before development commences or in accordance with the submitted timetable.

Condition : 15 - No development shall take place until a written report, prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person, detailing any contamination related risks that have been revealed by any phase II intrusive investigations has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The investigation shall have been carried out in accordance with the preliminary investigation and the report shall present proposals for the removal, containment or otherwise being rendered harmless of any contamination and measures to verify the adequacy of decontamination work. Further investigation shall be carried out at such points and at such depths as the local planning authority may stipulate if this report is found to be insufficient. Risk assessments must adhere to current UK guidance and best practice. 

The report shall include details of such sampling of soil, soil vapour, ground gas, surface water and groundwater at such locations and depths as are considered to characterise the site conditions in accordance with the findings of the preliminary investigation and in accordance with current guidance and legislation including Environment Agency Contaminated Land Report 11 (CLR11). Documentation of decontamination works relevant to demolition- for instance asbestos removal- may contribute to the phase II report.

It shall also include a tiered contamination risk assessment based on the proposed end use of the site together with a suitably detailed remediation strategy designed to mitigate all risks to sensitive receptors posed by any contamination identified and details of a procedure for the management and reporting of unexpected contamination.

It is understood that some demolition/ preliminary site work may be necessary to enable this investigation but this shall not be construed as commencement of the development. 

The scheme for decontamination shall provide details of how each potential pollutant linkage, as identified in the conceptual

Condition : 16 - If any contamination not previously identified is encountered during development, whether from a different source or of a different type to that addressed in the approved investigations and remedial measures, or in an area expected to have been uncontaminated, then a revised scheme to deal with that contamination prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person, shall be submitted in writing to the local planning authority for approval in writing within one month of the discovery of such contamination; the remedial works so identified shall be carried out in accordance with the details approved by the local planning authority before the development is first brought into use.

Condition : 17 - The works of site decontamination and verification of those works, as agreed with the local planning authority, shall be carried out before the development is occupied or in accordance with the programme specified in this permission or such other programme approved in writing by the local planning authority. These works shall be certified as having been carried out in accordance with the terms of the approved programme by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person. The verification report shall be submitted to the local planning authority for approval in writing before the development is first brought into use.  
The verification report shall revisit the site conceptual model, and provide evidence that each aspect of the decontamination scheme was carried out correctly and successfully and describe how any unexpected contamination uncovered during the building process was managed. This report shall prove that the development is safe and suitable for its new use in terms of land quality.

Condition : 18 - All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) of net power of 37kW and up to and including 560kW used during the course of the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development hereby approved shall comply with the emission standards set out in chapter 7 of the GLA's supplementary planning guidance (SPG) 'Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition' dated July 2014, or subsequent guidance. Unless it complies with the standards set out in the SPG, no NRMM shall be on site, at any time, whether in use or not. The developer shall keep an up to date list of all NRMM used during the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development on the online register at https://nrmm.london/.

Condition : 19 - The approved refuse and recycling store as shown on approved plan no. 22110-OA-B1-ZZ-DR-A-3000 P17 shall be completed and made available for use before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, and thereafter shall be retained for such use at all times without obstruction. Bins shall be stored within the store at all times and shall not be left on the public highway.

Condition : 20 - The hereby approved development shall be constructed in accordance with the details outlined within the Combined Flood Risk Assessment and Drainage Impact Assessment (22706-DIA-001 rev A).

Condition : 21 - The hereby approved development shall not be commenced until the recommendations of the submitted Preliminary Ecological Assessment (ASW/MBL/136/26/2022) dated January 2023 have been undertaken in regards to a follow- up bat emergency survey, the development shall thereafter be constructed in accordance with the other recommendations contained within the assessment.

Condition : 23 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, a Car Parking Management Plan shall first be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details and shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development, unless the prior written approval of the local planning authority is obtained to secure any variation.

Condition : 24 - No development above ground level shall take place until full details of the Electric Vehicle Charging Points, each capable of  a minimum output of 7.2kW, are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include manufacturer's specifications and the number of spaces provided with active and passive capabilities shall comply with the London Plan standards.
The charging points shall be installed in accordance with the approved details, with photographic evidence submitted to the Local Planning Authority upon completion, and so maintained at all times thereafter.

Condition : 25 - No development shall take place until amended plans are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority showing the amended crossover to the front of the site no more than 4.2 metres wide.

Condition : 26 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, a Delivery & Servicing Plan (including details of vehicle access and egress arrangements and times that servicing shall take place) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall accord with current guidance such as that issued by TfL and include measures required to ensure sufficient arrangements (physical as well as managerial) for the servicing, including refuse collection, of all aspects of the development, the timing of hours for deliveries by motor vehicles and a timetable for implementation. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details and shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development, unless the prior written approval of the local planning authority is obtained to any variation.
